description.narrative: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) Hills Program on Governance is establishing a Governance Center in Nairobi, Kenya, to serve as an independent source of analysis, exchange, and policy recommendations on monitoring and curbing endemic corruption. One of the areas this program would study is corruption in the sale and distribution of HIV/AIDS drugs in this country where AIDS is a serious health risk. Ultimately, the Governance Center will attempt to catalyze a network of NGO institutions and educators in the field of ethics, transparency and anti-corruption work in Kenya that will generate anti-corruption research and materials; promote the transfer of practical experience in their use to other Kenya-based institutions for adaptation and implementation; and, identify additional issues in the anti-corruption field in need of increased identification, education and dissemination. Kenya is an MCC Threshold Country with potential for growth on the Control of Corruption indicator, in particular in the health sector. MCC gave $100,000 as a grant to this program to partially cover the costs of establishing this Governance Center and to fund a conference to help kick off the opening of the Center. The conference will bring together experts from the region to discuss corruption in the health sector in Eastern Africa.

title.narrative: Congressional Notification for Grant to CSIS Hills Program
